title: Final Games Trailer for 'Squid Game 3' - It All Comes Down To This!
description: "Bad people do bad things, but they blame others, and go on to live in peace." Indeed the truth. It's almost time to finally how it ends... It all comes down to this final stand. Netflix has debuted another new official trailer for Squid Game 3, the third and final season of the hit Korean thriller series about desperate people chasing money. The second season dropped last December though it's only half - Netflix decided to split it up into two final seasons. Is everyone ready for the grand finale? Will 456 finally put an end to this? We'll find out... Hundreds of cash-strapped players accept an invitation to play a series of games. A very tempting cash prize awaits with deadly high stakes: a whopping ₩45.6 billion prize for whoever can stay alive until the end. Director Hwang Dong-hyuk is about to deliver an especially bold ending, I can feel it. Squid Game 3's cast features Lee Jung-jae as 456 and Lee Byung-hun as The Front Man, both very popular already, as well as Yim Si-wan, Kang Ha-neul, Wi Ha-jun, Park Gyu-young, Park Sung-hoon, Yang Dong-geun, Kang Ae-sim, Jo Yuri, Lee David, & Roh Jae-won. This final trailer is […]
author: Alex Billington
excerpt: "Bad people do bad things, but they blame others, and go on to live in peace." Indeed the truth. It's almost time to finally how it ends... It all comes down to this final stand. Netflix has debuted another new official trailer for Squid Game 3, the third and final season of the hit Korean
text: by June 13, 2025Source: YouTube "Bad people do bad things, but they blame others, and go on to live in peace." Indeed the truth. It's almost time to finally how it ends... It all comes down to this final stand. Netflix has debuted another new official trailer for Squid Game 3, the third and final season of the hit Korean thriller series about desperate people chasing money. The second season dropped last December though it's only half - Netflix decided to split it up into two final seasons. Is everyone ready for the grand finale? Will 456 finally put an end to this? We'll find out... Hundreds of cash-strapped players accept an invitation to play a series of games. A very tempting cash prize awaits with deadly high stakes: a whopping ₩45.6 billion prize for whoever can stay alive until the end. Director Hwang Dong-hyuk is about to deliver an especially bold ending, I can feel it. Squid Game 3's cast features Lee Jung-jae as 456 and Lee Byung-hun as The Front Man, both very popular already, as well as Yim Si-wan, Kang Ha-neul, Wi Ha-jun, Park Gyu-young, Park Sung-hoon, Yang Dong-geun, Kang Ae-sim, Jo Yuri, Lee David, & Roh Jae-won. This final trailer is a "legacy trailer" looking back at everything from the first two seasons and all Player 456 has been through already. I'm ready for this. Here's the Final Games trailer for Hwang Dong-hyuk's Squid Game - Season 3, from Netflix's YouTube: You can watch the teaser trailer for Netflix's Squid Game - Season 3 right here and the main official trailer. The third and final season of Squid Game follows Gi-hun aka "456" (Lee Jung-jae) after losing his best friend in the game and being driven to utter despair by The Front Man (Lee Byung-hun), who was hiding his true identity to infiltrate the game. Gi-hun persists with his goal to put an end to the game, while the Front Man continues onto his next move. The surviving players' choices will lead to graver consequences with each round. The world eagerly awaits to see the grand finale written and directed by Hwang Dong-hyuk, who vowed to bring the epic story to its deserved closure once & for all. Can we hope for humanity in the cruelest of realities? Fans all over the world are counting the days until the final answer is revealed. Squid Game is a series all created and written and directed by Korean filmmaker Hwang Dong-hyuk, also director of the films My Father, Silenced, Miss Granny, The Fortress, plus Season 1 of Squid Game, which also won him an Emmy for Outstanding Directing. Produced by Firstman Studio in Korea. The first season premiered on Netflix in September 2021 and the second season debuted streaming last December. Executive produced by Kim Ji-yeon, Hwang Dong-hyuk. Netflix will be debuting Squid Game - Season 3 streaming on Netflix worldwide starting June 27th, 2025 coming up this summer. Ready to watch? How will it all end? Find more posts in: Hype, Streaming, To Watch, Trailer
html:
by
June 13, 2025
Source: YouTube

"Bad people do bad things, but they blame others, and go on to live in peace." Indeed the truth. It's almost time to finally how it ends... It all comes down to this final stand. Netflix has debuted another new official trailer for Squid Game 3, the third and final season of the hit Korean thriller series about desperate people chasing money. The second season dropped last December though it's only half - Netflix decided to split it up into two final seasons. Is everyone ready for the grand finale? Will 456 finally put an end to this? We'll find out... Hundreds of cash-strapped players accept an invitation to play a series of games. A very tempting cash prize awaits with deadly high stakes: a whopping ₩45.6 billion prize for whoever can stay alive until the end. Director Hwang Dong-hyuk is about to deliver an especially bold ending, I can feel it. Squid Game 3's cast features Lee Jung-jae as 456 and Lee Byung-hun as The Front Man, both very popular already, as well as Yim Si-wan, Kang Ha-neul, Wi Ha-jun, Park Gyu-young, Park Sung-hoon, Yang Dong-geun, Kang Ae-sim, Jo Yuri, Lee David, & Roh Jae-won. This final trailer is a "legacy trailer" looking back at everything from the first two seasons and all Player 456 has been through already. I'm ready for this.

Here's the Final Games trailer for Hwang Dong-hyuk's Squid Game - Season 3, from Netflix's YouTube:

You can watch the teaser trailer for Netflix's Squid Game - Season 3 right here and the main official trailer.

The third and final season of Squid Game follows Gi-hun aka "456" (Lee Jung-jae) after losing his best friend in the game and being driven to utter despair by The Front Man (Lee Byung-hun), who was hiding his true identity to infiltrate the game. Gi-hun persists with his goal to put an end to the game, while the Front Man continues onto his next move. The surviving players' choices will lead to graver consequences with each round. The world eagerly awaits to see the grand finale written and directed by Hwang Dong-hyuk, who vowed to bring the epic story to its deserved closure once & for all. Can we hope for humanity in the cruelest of realities? Fans all over the world are counting the days until the final answer is revealed.

Squid Game is a series all created and written and directed by Korean filmmaker Hwang Dong-hyuk, also director of the films My Father, Silenced, Miss Granny, The Fortress, plus Season 1 of Squid Game, which also won him an Emmy for Outstanding Directing. Produced by Firstman Studio in Korea. The first season premiered on Netflix in September 2021 and the second season debuted streaming last December. Executive produced by Kim Ji-yeon, Hwang Dong-hyuk. Netflix will be debuting Squid Game - Season 3 streaming on Netflix worldwide starting June 27th, 2025 coming up this summer. Ready to watch? How will it all end?

Find more posts in: Hype, Streaming, To Watch, Trailer
